definition[0]: a situation in which workers stop working for a short time as a protest
example[0]: time lost in disputes and stoppages
example[1]: a work stoppage by government employees
definition[1]: when something stops moving or happening
example[2]: We had five minutes of stoppage time  (=extra time played in a sports match because of pauses) at the end of the first half.
definition[2]: something that blocks a tube or container
example[4]: The stoppage was called (=organized) to protest against the cancellation of wage agreements.
definition[3]: the act of stopping something from moving or happening
definition[4]: money from your wages that your employer keeps in order to pay your tax, for your PENSION etc
example[6]: I earn Â£200 a week before stoppages.
